intro: Rotheca macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stemmed rotheca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and marshes. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. The showy yellow flowers appear in late summer and are followed by fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds.
